dt: {bc}to deprive of something valuable by the use of deceit or fraud

dt.t: {wi}cheated{/wi} the elderly couple out of their property

dt: {bc}to influence or lead by deceit, trick, or artifice

dt.t: a young man who {wi}cheated{/wi} young women into marrying him when he was already married

dt: {bc}to elude or thwart by or as if by outwitting
{bc}to position oneself defensively near a particular area in anticipation of a play in that area

dt.t: the shortstop was {wi}cheating{/wi} toward second base

pt: {sc}cheat{/sc} {sc}cozen{/sc} {sc}defraud{/sc} {sc}swindle{/sc} mean to get something by dishonesty or deception. {sc}cheat{/sc} suggests using trickery that escapes observation.
{sc}cozen{/sc} implies artful persuading or flattering to attain a thing or a purpose.

pt.t: always able to {it}cozen{/it} her grandfather out of a few dollars

pt: {sc}defraud{/sc} stresses depriving one of his or her rights and usually connotes deliberate perversion of the truth.

pt.t: {it}defrauded{/it} of her inheritance by an unscrupulous lawyer

pt: {sc}swindle{/sc} implies large-scale cheating by misrepresentation or abuse of confidence.

pt.t: {it}swindled{/it} of their savings by con artists

shortdef: to deprive of something valuable by the use of deceit or fraud
to influence or lead by deceit, trick, or artifice
to elude or thwart by or as if by outwitting

dt: {bc}the act or an instance of fraudulently deceiving {bc}{sx|deception||}, {sx|fraud||}

dt.t: His financial activity turned out to be a great {wi}cheat{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a code (such as a button combination or password) that activates a hidden feature or capability in a computer or video game

dt.t: In fact, some game levels are so tough that I had to resort to {wi}cheats{/wi} to get through.
Most people think that using a {wi}cheat code{/wi} is the only way to earn a dishonest reward …

et: probably from a deceptive resemblance to grain

dt: {bc}the obtaining of property from another by an intentional active distortion of the truth

et: earlier {it}cheat{/it} forfeited property, from Middle English {it}chet{/it} escheat, short for {it}eschete{/it} {ma}{mat|escheat|}{/ma}
shortdef: the act or an instance of fraudulently deceiving : deception, fraud
a code (such as a button combination or password) that activates a hidden feature or capability in a computer or video game

dt: {bc}a sheet containing information (such as test answers) used secretly for cheating
{bc}a written or graphic aid (such as a sheet of notes) that can be referred to for help in understanding or remembering something complex

shortdef: a sheet containing information (such as test answers) used secretly for cheating
a written or graphic aid (such as a sheet of notes) that can be referred to for help in understanding or remembering something complex

dt: {bc}to take a risk hoping to be lucky

shortdef: to take a risk hoping to be lucky

dt: {bc}to break a promise made to (someone, such as one's wife or husband) by having sex with someone else

shortdef: to break a promise made to (someone, such as one's wife or husband) by having sex with someone else
